abstract: Doctors Without Borders operates hospital in Amman, Jordan, treating thousands of Middle Eastern war casualties since its 2006 opening; medical care access in Syria has been severely hampered by government military targeting hospitals in Islamic strongholds, and withdrawal of healthcare teams due to kidnappings.
lead_paragraph: More people injured in the Syrian war are seeking treatment in Jordan, where health care facilities are more secure and a new reconstructive surgery hospital opened this month.

headline.main: Hospitals Devastated in Syria, War-Wounded Seek Treatment in Jordan
headline.print_headline: Hospitals Devastated in Syria, War-Wounded Seek Treatment in Jordan

snippet: More people injured in the Syrian war are seeking treatment in Jordan, where health care facilities are more secure and a new reconstructive surgery hospital opened this month.
